questions.question_text:
A user is experiencing odd issues related to their device displaying a distorted picture on the screen.

What is the first step they can take to possibly resolve this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I’m cool with C, unless someone’s got a better take.

questions.question_text: You are managing the "Customer Kiosk" child organization and need to pin devices to maintain stability and security. How would you configure your Chrome update settings to achieve this?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Off the top of my head, I’d say B.

choices.D: “Always use a network access control deny” policy to deny the URLs.
choices.A: “Always use the proxy specified below”, and provide the IP:port to the proxy services.
choices.B: “Always use the proxy auto-config specified below”, and provide the IP:port information.
choices.C: “Always use the proxy specified below”, and provide the URL to pac file configuration.

questions.question_text: A global organization is deploying a fleet of ChromeOS devices to all their users. Organization policy requires all web traffic to be filtered using an existing proxy service to prevent access to 1 million unauthorized websites. What ChromeOS policy should you configure to meet this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Could be wrong, but I’m backing C.

Selected Answer: B
I’m going with B — the rest don’t quite add up.

questions.question_text: The finance Department is concerned about frequent Chromebook updates and asks you to explore a 6-month update cycle. Which update release option should you configure for these devices?
What are the minimum device hardware requirements required to test or install ChromeOS Flex?

choices.C: Intel/AMD x86-64-bit compatible device, 2GB RAM, 8GB internal storage
choices.D: Intel/AMD x86-64-bit compatible device or ARM based processor, 4GB RAM, 16GB internal storage
choices.B: Intel/AMD x86-64-bit compatible device, 4GB RAM, 16GB internal storage.
choices.A: Intel/AMD x86-64-bit compatible device or ARM based processor, 2GB RAM, 8GB internal storage.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
If I had to pick, I’d go with D.
